content.en: CT Scan Optimization: Researchers have been investigating the use of algorithms to improve image quality and reduce radiation dose in various types of CT scans. These algorithms, such as Adaptive Statistical Iterative Reconstruction (ASIR) and Model-Based Iterative Reconstruction (MBIR), are being studied to determine their effectiveness in achieving equivalent image quality at lower radiation dose levels. The findings of these studies could have significant implications for improving the safety and accuracy of CT scans, particularly in areas such as pediatric imaging and oncology.
content.da: Optimering af CT-scanning: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af algoritmer til at forbedre billedkvaliteten og reducere stråledosis i forskellige typer CT-scanninger. Disse algoritmer, såsom Adaptive Statistical Iterative Reconstruction (ASIR) og Model-Based Iterative Reconstruction (MBIR), studeres for at vurdere deres effektivitet til at opnå tilsvarende billedkvalitet ved lavere stråledosisniveauer. Resultaterne af disse studier kan have betydelige konsekvenser for forbedringen af sikkerheden og nøjagtigheden af CT-scanninger, særligt inden for områder som pædiatrisk billeddannelse og onkologi.
